posts.body:
Wouldn't it be better if /pol/ were a distinct zeronet site, with the less popular boards being this multi-board type of variant?

Reason being, you only ever need to moderate content being stored to/seeded from your machine on the one board you routinely visit.

In lieu of that, I'm muting all the other boards but it'd make my life much easier if I didn't have to.

posts.subject: Why make this temporary?
posts.body:
By virtue of necessity, we have a software which cannot be censored. A message which cannot be deplatformed. In that, a foundation for a new generation of decentralized communication.

This is evolution.

>>32eba9ec-af35-4e20-8c9a-3d2f70a607ae
This was my observation. 4chan is an excellent example of the tremendous degree to which cointelpro strategies can be used against us, how AI can be employed against us, etc. That's all pretty difficult to do when any user can ban any other user.

We've had to go this route with video sharing as well, with bitchute and peertube. Chat software in the form of Riot. We haven't even moved any further from the public sphere than we were already -- 8ch was pretty obscure in the first place.
Hope is in the PNW, anon. They can't push us into obscurity if our communities exist irl.

There's no reason not to be NS if you're pro-white.

Anything else is just racial cuckoldry.

>>3fbc00db-a515-461b-ac5e-6d3f2f7a5810
Do you? You can have an entire neighborhood who thinks like you. You can talk to girls irl who are explicitly pro-white. You can work at a job where your boss doesn't want your race to die.

You're right and that's a good thing

Fuck boomers

>>f36360d3-41d5-4c42-8841-0d5e71813d26
>>b86437b1-1afd-42ec-b0fb-9ca2e0930ecf
Yeah, I live around them. Maybe the women in your area are shit but up here, in the NS communities, they're all pro-white. Women are a reflection of the social group they belong to, and that's true in this case too.

>>f7057fe6-1b60-4a92-a712-8931c6672bed
I wish, but I think we both know that won't happen.

>>ab363a43-54a3-4f7f-9709-dcdc2485b043
I want explicit white well-being. I don't care about the taxes or who can and cannot vote. I care about whether or not my children will live a better life than me. I care about my family continuing to exist. No more doublespeak or proxy arguments.

>>66cc4c5c-2fcc-408a-ac59-93cbcdaa1e1a
I'm telling you that there are clandestine(mostly) NS communities in the Pacific Northwest where fit, racially-aware white guys can meet racially-aware white women who are sane and from good families.

Don't bother if you don't want to have like 10 kids though.
Is there a way to automate that?

>>021d908c-e29d-45c1-a154-c076789ec8e6
Probably because I don't ever want to hear anything a leftist has to say

>>6e326cd5-f65e-4ff7-acb4-dc52541ea63a
You're assuming you can argue with a leftist. Waste of time.

>>2f0ba8bd-cda0-4f6a-baa1-5d36220911ff
Nah they can eat shit
As it dies we'll form our own nation. Such is the cycle of civilization.

>>814d87e2-c1fd-44a1-9216-322fd76023dc
Yeah, I'm not being very (((tolerant))), I know

>>b487a2aa-d218-4aa0-9315-c18166cc8cc9
There's nothing inherently wrong with censoring your enemies, except that you should always be on the giving side.

Evolution does not feature this kind of egalitarian nonsense and we should follow suit if our species is to improve.

>>2e282072-d0e5-40bf-96e5-84fa54a882dd
You can use Tor and zeronet via android.
Now we ALL do it for free

>>324e5972-3ba8-45c1-a93c-28d7e3c73362
While this works, it's a bad solution because it re-enables fingerprinting globally. 08chan is fine because it doesn't exploit the html5 canvas to get info about your system, but if you re-enable it globally and use some other zeronet site, or if 08chan starts collecting that info in the future, you can very easily be tracked via a hardware fingerprint.

The Tor browser has a solution to this: enable the html5 canvas for only one specific site. An even better solution is to enable the html5 canvas only on 08chan and *only* when you upload an image. The Tor browser has the luxury of its own browser to do this with and zeronet does not, but a firefox plugin could easily be made to serve this same purpose. Ideally you'd have your own browser exclusively for Zeronet.

For now though you should re-enable these settings after every image upload. Maybe just have a temporary browser add-on that's just a toggle button for those settings, for convenience? Develop a solution that doesn't use the HTML5 canvas?

The incentive to seed is basically the "sage" function of 08chan. Shitposting gets holed.

This is the best way to do things for an imageboard.
The mute function lets us very effectively shoah all qfags. So even if they come here, they won't last long. Watch them bitch about not being able to load images and posts and not know why lol.

The genius of it is that you don't *want* to seed everything. When you make a thread or a post, you are seed number 1. Every subsequent seed is an implicit bump of your post, every mute a sage. It's the same system as old but now decentralized, with no need for moderators. Your choice to seed or mute a user and their content *is* your moderation.

>>610dd2c2-17f6-4583-a80e-a4e777916303
If the current one doesn't work out, we can very easily make another. Zeronet sites are incredibly easy to deploy at no cost.

posts.subject: Future Development of 08chan
posts.body:
ALRIGHT, GUYS, GET IN HERE
Let's turn this bunker into a home with a to-do list.

#1. Fix image uploads on tor. Open for ideas on this, but not using HTML5 canvas for image uploads is probably the best solution.

#2. Because the [seed] and [mute] functions are so critical to the health and function of this board, they should be emphasized in the UI, and explained via a sticky. Effectively they're the "bump" and "sage," or "upvote" and "downvote," respectively. Except it's actually relevant because you can self-moderate content this way and blackhole shit content.

#3. Encourage Tor/VPN use and provide guides for PERSEC to make it difficult for an informed poster to be tracked. VPN use is a whole other topic though -- we need GOOD VPNs.

#4. Implement user IDs that use the zeronet IDs, cross-thread. This is intuitive enough for native users to not be tracked this way, as they'd change their ID when appropriate, but lets us spot shills easily.

#5. Add banners and spruce the place up. Make "SEED CONTENT YOU LIKE YOU FAGS" banners. Develop culture around self-moderation.

#6. Go full text-board, or create a separate zite that is text-only. Solves the CP issue and the space issue in one go. Possibly make all images "spoilered" to prevent thumbnail saving?

#7. Develop a culture of sincerity by taking a hard-line stance against zero-effort posters: "If you don't put any effort into your post, then I don't want to see your post." [M]ute all non-effort posters. If shills are going to shill, they're gonna have to work a lot harder.

#8. Add the thread update number that appears on tabs when a thread has new posts. This is a QOL improvement. This is the [1] you see on a tab when that thread updates with a new post.


I'll edit this post to add to the list as more is posted.

>>1dcd63c9-2848-4b79-9cfe-b817405b824e
I've made a thread for development-related discussion.
>>67107dc8-1cce-4474-9064-f9f47d80e399

>>d6212c7e-8969-437b-bfc7-93d0f0459b03
I've made a thread for this discussion
>>67107dc8-1cce-4474-9064-f9f47d80e399

>>ede58eb7-bbf4-4148-9902-514f305c37ca
Good ideas. We should clarify, "SEED CONTENT YOU LIKE." I'll edit these into the OP.

Which, by the way, is a feature I love.

>>53af36cf-1515-4d76-8bfc-2d73bcc67a45
That's trivial, all things considered, but you're right. What's that non-kiked alternative to github? We could use that.

>>cfe01971-8aed-4a25-8711-a79ecebecacf
Exactly. Even after they do change their ID, it's so trivial to mute them that they're wasting their time.

This is how it always should have been done.

>>b9476d73-90cf-4969-9655-c7ecdd257e34
A zeronet-hosted code repository seems appropriate.

>>8ee199cd-3079-4479-9c6a-256e6eb64d78
Tor makes all HTML5 canvas requests a pure white document to prevent tracking. So any Tor uploads with fingerprinting disabled will be just a white image and (I think) fail altogether.

>>d85c6417-b04b-44b9-8d72-5fa4ef1d01e2
Completely agree. This is the superior solution, even if it does require a bit of work. There are practical considerations that weren't as much of an issue before though, such as outreach. We aren't going to be tapping into the normie sphere with the reduction in accessibility that zeronet provides, but then we didn't get that even with 8ch. In fact, it's not even desirable. We don't want normies here. If we want normies, we'll go and get normies. But that "go and get normies" should now be considered, since that has to be a distinct process from the board itself.

Mobile compatibility is lacking too though. An entire discussion can be had about the mobile question.

>>e333a45f-04da-4091-b55f-aa2dc547384d
It certainly got me onto it, and it would be very easy to spread this software among our various communities.

>>e7917e49-e887-45ba-8523-34a1cc0345e2
This might be the proof of concept we needed to use more p2p solutions in all of our software and communications. Video sharing being a big one.

>>797c0ef8-eb44-4f85-8ace-7b81657c0e48
Zeronet already uses the blockchain to verify content isn't modified, so you can't overwhelm the network with modified content like you could with purely p2p.

>>86088af8-4697-4cda-93ac-08135e3afe9b
The bigger issue is that files are actually very difficult to delete. Even if you "deleted them," they're still there and can be recovered if your hardware is seized.

We could always do something like start using RAM drives for web browsing. Would solve that problem 100%.

>>e6be8ff5-392d-4162-8ec3-384153706751
Yeah, but it's still clearnet and centralized. Vulnerable to the same shit that took down 8ch, and Tor/VPN use isn't common with it.

>>eee47b9c-5136-4c98-a6bf-6041c4f09558
Blackholing shills is far more important. We proved this with the 4chan -> 8ch transition.

>>06df7cc0-0aee-4139-aa5d-1f1cf052127a
No, zeronet uses an arbitrary ID system instead of IP. Basically like a cookie.

>>691b4745-196a-4f96-9098-c653d900f0db
Yeah, to publish changes and to prevent the kind of attacks you're talking about. It's a hybrid of that and p2p.

>>877a25ed-4974-432b-8a3d-11299376e90e
The last part of that is particularly important for posting images as a Tor user. You can do it within the Tor browser safely because you can enable the HTML5 canvas on a per-site basis.

ALWAYS MUTE SHIT POSTERS
[M]

DO NOT CONTRIBUTE TO A SHIT BOARD

>>559c905f-af2a-4bfd-a8f0-9ffdd98abbf9
Another advantage to mobile is being able to use other people's networks as a rule. Connect to coffee-shop wifi? Mcdonalds? Some unsecured network down the road? You're completely safe.

>>0273fdeb-f85f-4435-90bd-a006bb6bcff8
This is actually not a bad idea at all. It also solves the space issue. If nothing else, a text-board version of /pol/ should be available to people. It would make zeronet much more popular since the current disincentive is the "you could be framed with CP" thing,

>>46bee5fd-ab9f-4269-b518-ad11d116b192
I'm all for making a zite of my own for you guys, as I'm sure many of us are. It takes nothing to create a new zite. The problem is proving to people that you aren't a glownigger -- how do you do that without doxxing yourself?
I wonder if they'll explain the mute function too. Probably not.

The problem with this kind of legislature is that it's currently 100% legal to produce your own firearm. The assumption is that very few people will be able to do so, but with the advent of 3D printing and the greater availability of laser sintered metal, it's possible to automate the production of a firearm for everything but the barrel and bolt, which still need to be harder than what a 3D printer can produce. Both of which can be purchased or salvaged.

They've forced us to adopt technology like zeronet. If they introduce these types of laws, we'll just make sure they don't know what guns we have by producing them ourselves.

>>c2091e2d-995d-4ddd-8179-ffc2a67af5a3
I guess that's what I'd like to see as well. It just leaves a bad taste in my mouth. The feds or kikes could be clever enough to imitate that kind of sincerity.

That just makes it that much more important to get this done before they do, I suppose.

DO NOT TOLERATE SHITPOSTING

[M]UTE THEM IMMEDIATELY

IT'S BETTER TO HAVE A SMALLER, SECURE, COHESIVE COMMUNITY THAN A LARGER AND INSECURE ONE.

KIKES WORK BY SQUEEZING THEMSELVES THROUGH ANY CRACK, NO MATTER HOW SMALL AND INSIGNIFICANT. GIVE. THEM. NOTHING.

>>4f4dade6-f49f-4f8b-bf75-b15df70fba54
OBSERVE THIS KIKE TACTIC. TO SILENCE DISSENT, THEY CALL EVERYONE A JEW, EVERYONE A GLOWNIGGER, EVERYONE A SHILL.

IT'S EASY TO TELL. [M]UTE EVERYONE WHO DOES NOT PUT EFFORT INTO THEIR POSTS. DEVELOP A CULTURE OF SINCERITY.

Your premise is wrong. Within certain WN spheres, this is known:

There is no degree of information or  logic that can convince a person. Not because they're particularly resistant to your ideas -- but because people aren't won over by logic and information in the first place.

People are won over by social pressure, first and foremost. If your voice is the only dissenting voice and you are alone, people will see your ideas as alarming and terrifying as they imply loneliness and vulnerability, and you will be shunned as though you harbor some disease. Conversely, if your ideas are presented by a larger social group, which provides security with numbers and other means, they will adopt your ideas even with the absence of information and logic, as we see with the modern lemming.

The reason for this is evolutionary. People do not join social groups for their truthfulness. They do it for security. The sun-worshiping tribe of 1000 is always more alluring than the science tribe of 10.

So how do you develop this social group? Well, we're already on our way to it. Over time, our community has become much closer by necessity. It quickly becomes necessary to do that geographically as well, to focus our collective social influence onto some population. Machiavelli termed this "colonization," the non-violent takeover of a territory. This is what our enemies are doing to us and it's about time we started fighting back.

Sounds like the kikes and shills are infinitely butthurt that they now have absolutely zero power.

I'm going to continue using the [M]ute function. Anyone who puts no effort into their post will be muted and I don't give a god damn if they're genuine or not. We need to build a culture of SINCERITY and the best way of doing that is by drawing this line in the sand: if you do not put effort into your post then I do not want to see your post.

>>2532d21d-5396-4d6b-a7d5-1a673271dd16
We don't have control over those "credible sources" because the dominant authority decides which sources are credible. Machiavelli talked about this too, in "The Prince," he explained that princes have the power to make or destroy nobles at will. That applies to ZOG, but it also applies to us -- we are also our own prince. If you want to develop the kind of authority you're talking about, you need a social group in real life. This is something we're already doing with the Northwest Imperative -- lots of people already up here. You don't have to live around anti-white bullshit anymore. We have a choice now.

>>7d4dad79-9651-4152-b214-f2dc6f3e8f59
I have no problems with censorship and shutting down free speech and discussion. No problem at all.

Communists should be censored. Kikes should be censored. Shills and glowniggers should be censored. I have NO TOLERANCE for disgusting little snakes like you and I think you'll find that's a common attitude around here.

>>18c39df3-0c61-4d31-9fc8-55b0063904d5
Exactly. We need to pay great attention to how we proceed from here and learn from the past: do not give our enemies even an inch to stand on. Do not listen to their rhetoric about tolerating dissenting views. As Marty Robbins said, "Burn your draft card if you like, it's good to disagree. That's a get aquainted Communistic kiss."

Give. Them. NOTHING.

>>79c27a03-4bb1-4c0e-baeb-c86e6a834592
No. You just order it online and it gets shipped to your door.

>>bc051c9d-d919-40f4-aa48-0c45cdc56634
Due to how Zeronet operates, I imagine it'd be easier to have separate zites for each board. It makes managing the entire seeding process much easier to track and control. I'm thinking a /pol/ zite and a /bmw/ zite.

Because they can't. Content isn't shared via a central server, it's shared via peers who download it. The [M]ute function (upper right of post) lets you blacklist and delete all of their content from your drive. So if everyone [M]utes you then no one is seeding your content. People will just see a loading icon on your images and the images will never load, because you'll be trying to upload your gore to hundreds of different computers individually, effectively DDOSing yourself.

>>d86088c0-2775-4977-8782-eecfe06e3d6e
Again, that's not how content publishing works in zeronet. You're saying they could use some seed boxes. I'm saying you can mute those seed boxes. You're saying they'll generate new IDs. I'm saying if they do that, they no longer seed their old content, and they leave it to other people who haven't [M]uted them to continue perpetuating it.

You cannot force bullshit onto a zeronet network. There is no vulnerability there.

>>5018efd2-dc81-4e35-961e-61e1a89d990b
The Tor browser has other features that increase anonymity. For example, it allows you to enable the HTML5 Canvas on a per-site basis, so you can upload images via Tor here without leaving a vulnerability elsewhere. There are a lot of features like that.

Low effort posts get [M]uted.

Do not assume that you can discern shitposting from malicious intent. [M]ute both.
Because you'd have to disable Tor to use it effectively, leaving your ass out on the zeronet highway.
/pol/lack here. I'm just glad we finally ditched the newfags.

>>e42e58a9-d3e9-4d58-9a3d-9ab7a14462cc
>No, that's a great point actually, but I was just talking about regular users seeding spam inadvertently. Have you really muted all the boards you aren't constantly monitoring for spam? You might be seeding spam right now on one of the boards you aren't active on.
You don't seed things you don't look at. If you don't open those boards, you don't seed them. Common misconception.

>Sure, but that's like arguing you can filter people on 8chan. It's just placebo. It wouldn't be any difference if other boxes are seeding even if yours isn't, it would still show up on everybody's catalog until they manually mute thread by thread.
8ch used a central server, so the same bandwidth was allocated to shit content as good content. That's where the vulnerability is with spamming. Zeronet relies on users to voluntarily seed content. That means expanding spam threads, for example, expanding spam images. This means that spam will get very little bandwidth and any seedboxes will be easily banned.

>That's not how it works. I don't have your ID, yet I'm seeding your posts.
>Whenever I switch IDs, my machine is still seeding the posts I made with the previous IDs.
I think you're misunderstanding, or maybe I'm not phrasing it very well. Because content you publish relies on YOU to propagate it. Suppose you're a seedbox and spamming gore, for example. You post one thread, change IDs, and post another. Your old ID is no longer seeding that first thread -- your new ID is. If someone mutes your new ID, both threads are no longer seeded to that person. You cannot maintain two IDs simultaneously to seed bullshit. So there's always only ever one ID for someone to mute.

There's also no "inadvertent" seeding of content. They need to expand those gore images. They need to open that thread.

Instead, what you end up with is a catalog with a lot of gore at the bottom of it, whose images you cannot load, never being bumped or seeded. It's a non-issue.

>>7f7a8017-5536-4de6-9f52-54b8bec74ccc
I said this in the other thread about spambots, but it's a non-issue here. You cannot seed from two IDs simultaneously and users must expand your content to begin seeding it. At worst, you'll have thumbnails and OP posts being seeded but never bumped and they'll fall to the bottom of the catalog. Otherwise they'll need to invest into spamming threads, which can be more easily muted.
Have a [seed]

>>641ea5af-a201-4431-8d90-878777f6388d
So the goal is to just saturate the board? Well that's ineffective because their spam threads won't be bumped.

>>54faed18-61fc-492c-bbbc-e1d2e97a760b
You only seed content you look at. Just don't open any of the other boards and you won't seed them.

>>7d5557d8-4327-489e-933b-5d7080fc223a
Ok, so how much money are they willing to throw at shutting us down? $5 for an hour, for a full year, is $43,830. Because hosting sites on zeronet is free, we can simply make another, parallel site, while not shutting the original down. $43,830 is now $87,660, because we could just return to the last one if they stopped spamming it. With each iteration, the bots are forced to seed the rest of the site's content because muting users means they're less effective. So they're literally paying for the deployment of hundreds, maybe thousands of these boards, which costs us nothing to make.

So how much? A million? If we make just 12 sites, we've exceeded their funding. A billion? That'll take a bit more effort at 115 sites. How many zeronet sites can you make in an hour? A black hawk helicopter costs 1.4 billion. That's 319 sites to meet the equivalent of shooting one of those down. Every year. And it costs us nothing.

If they want to go that route, I'll happily oblige.

>>9fb74cf1-7b9f-4918-9add-ecae9cd4f701
It's a UI issue, mostly. You need to expand a thread to mute it and the mute button always does a check with a really long animation. When really, the [M] should just immediately mute that ID. With the blacklist off, it should be possible to unmute an ID as well.

Basically just needs a UI change. I'll look into it.

We really just need a mute button on the catalog without any gay transitions.

I'm digging through the javascript but so much of this shit is minified that I'm pretty lost atm. I wish they would've just used css for the transitions.

>>6b1417da-b609-4490-b31f-25fcc2d432b5
>Right now I'm lmaoing at the retards who were all like
>>nuhhh muh mute button makes spam impossibru lel
It'd take 30 seconds to mute all the spam in this thread if there wasn't any confirmation for it and another 30 seconds to mute all the spam in the catalog if there was a mute button there as well.

It's a UI issue. Spam mitigation should be a thing anyway but the confirmations and transitions make muting a single post take like 10 seconds.

>>ca43277a-c9d5-4186-a270-eff94d830ceb
Another solution would be using checkboxes on the catalog to mute threads in batches. That way there isn't any delay. A user could mute a slew of spam threads in a very short span of time that way and it'd be easy to add. If I can figure out how the js works.

>>ca43277a-c9d5-4186-a270-eff94d830ceb (You)
Another solution would be using checkboxes on the catalog to mute threads in batches. That way there isn't any delay. A user could mute a slew of spam threads in a very short span of time that way and it'd be easy to add. If I can figure out how the js works.
